title: Recursive Sum of Digits
description:
Recursive Sum of Digits
Given a number N, find the sum of it's digits. If the sum if not a single digit number then again find the sum of it's digits. Repeat this procedure until you get a single digit sum and then print it.

Input Format:
  • 1st line contains an integer T(Number of testcases/inputs).
  • Next T lines contains the numbers n1, n2, n3, ..., nT.
Output Format:
For each number n1, n2, n3, ..., nT, print their recursive sum in separate lines.

Input:
2
123
123456
Output:
6
3
Explaination:
  • 1 + 2 + 3 = 6
  • 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 + 6 = 21 => 2 + 1 = 3
shortDescription:
Given a number N, find the sum of it's digits. If the sum if not a single digit
number then again find the sum of it's digits. Repeat this procedure until you get a
single digit sum and then print it.

title: Volume of a cube
description:
Volume of a cube
Given a cube of integral side length n, calculate it's volume and print it on the console.

Input Format:
An integer n.

Output Format:
The volume of the cube of side length n, i.e. n3.

Sample Input:
 5
Sample Output:
 125
Note:
Provide your inputs (each in separate line) in the Input box below the code editor, before running your program.
shortDescription: Given a cube of integral side length n, calculate it's volume and print it on the console.

title: Vowel Count
description:
Vowel Count
Harsh's little brother just learnt about vowels in the school, Harsh being a coder wants to showcase his coding skils to his little brother. Help Harsh to Write an Algorithm which takes an string and prints the number of vowels present in that string.

Input Format:
  • 1st line contains an integer T (Number of strings).
  • Next T lines contains the strings S1, S2, S3, ..., ST.
Output Format:
For each string S1, S2, S3, ..., ST., print the number of vowels present in it (each in separate lines).

Sample Input:
5
I love Vowels.
A little knowledge is a dangerous thing.
Good things come in small packages.
It doesn't take that much time to read the complete question, read it thoroughly.
CoUnT BoTh CAPITAL AnD small VoWeLs.
Sample Output:
5
13
10
26
10
shortDescription: Harsh's little brother just learnt about vowels in the school, Harsh being a coder wants to showcase his coding skils to his little brother. Help Harsh to Write an Algorithm which takes an string and prints the number of vowels present in that string.
sampleInput:
5
I love Vowels.
A little knowledge is a dangerous thing.
Good things come in small packages.
It doesn't take that much time to read the complete question, read it thoroughly.
CoUnT BoTh CAPITAL AnD small VoWeLs.

title: Print Odd Numbers
description:
Print Odd Numbers
Given two integers start and end. Print all the odd number within the range [start, end] i.e. Closed Interval.
Fun Challenge : Try this without using if statement.

Input Format:
  • First line contains an integer start.
  • Second line contains an integer end.
Output Format:
All the odd numbers within the range [start, end] in separate lines (In increasing order).

Sample Input:
 11
 18
Sample Output:
 11
 13
 15
 17
Note:
If you are not able to understand how input and output works, ask your senior right now. Otherwise you may face problem in the actual competition.
shortDescription: Given two integers start and end. Print all the odd number within the range [start, end] i.e. Closed Interval.

title: Prime Factorization
description:
Prime Factorization
Given a series of numbers n1, n2, n3, ..., nT, find the prime factorization of each number.

Input Format:
  • 1st line contains an integer T(Number of testcases/inputs).
  • Next T lines contains the numbers n1, n2, n3, ..., nT.
Output Format:
For each number n1, n2, n3, ..., nT, print their prime factorization in separate lines.

Input:
 7
 6
 23
 16
 50
 60
 1309
 16422
Output:
 6 = 2 * 3
 23 = 23
 16 = 2 * 2 * 2 * 2
 50 = 2 * 5 * 5
 60 = 2 * 2 * 3 * 5
 1309 = 7 * 11 * 17
 16422 = 2 * 3 * 7 * 17 * 23
shortDescription: Given a series of numbers n<sub>1</sub>, n<sub>2</sub>, n<sub>3</sub>, ..., n<sub>T</sub>, find the prime factorization of each number.
